name: hoecake
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a kind of flat bread made from cornmeal (= a kind of flour made from maize) : Hoecakes originate in Native American culture. Some people make hoecakes from wheat flour rather than cornmeal, but that's not the traditional way. I want to make some sourdough hoe cakes.
More examplesFewer examplesHoecakes are a staple of rural cuisine in the southern United States, where a lot of corn is grown.Another variation of the hoecake is an ashcake, which was cooked directly on the floor of a fireplace.
